questionListItems.title: Is outside food not allowed into Halal-certified eating establishment?

answer.body: Outside food is generally not allowed into any eating establishment, including the Halal-certified ones. However, this is more of a company's policy rather than a MUIS halal requirement. Baby food and food for the aged are of course exceptions to this case. We also provide guidelines to the certified companies to ensure that the halal integrity is not compromised.

Halal' is an Arabic word which means lawful or permissible. Any food or drink which falls under this category is permitted for Muslim consumption. Examples of Halal food include vegetables, spices and meat deriving from animals slaughtered in accordance with the Islamic Law. You may wish to visit our website https://www.muis.gov.sg/halal/ for more information.

questionListItems.title: I am concerned for our fellow Muslims who patronise restaurants that serve “Halal Non-Alcoholic Beverages (Wine, Beer, Spirits)”. What would Muis advice be?

answer.body: Generally, Muslim consumers are advised to exercise discretion before consuming any products. It is best to avoid a product when one feels “was-was” or doubtful.

questionListItems.title: How can I verify the validity and authenticity of the Halal certificate displayed at public eating places?

answer.body:
It is a MUIS halal requirement for any certified eating establishments to display their valid, original halal certificate prominently at the certified location. The name reflected on the certificate must also tally with the name of the foodstall/company name.

Should you patronise a stall and find that something is amiss, please report it to our office. We will follow up accordingly.

Many perceive this as a type of alcoholic drink. However, chocolate liquor, also known as cocoa liquor, is actually the liquid component obtained by the grinding of cocoa nibs from the cocoa bean. It converts cocoa powder and cocoa butter as end products. It is a primary ingredient in chocolate manufacture. This is different from chocolate liqueur, which is an alcoholic beverage with chocolate flavour. Chocolate liquor is generally halal, chocolate liqueur is not.

questionListItems.title: Do I need to have a Muis Halal certificate for fresh, whole eggs, to cater to the Muslim public?

answer.body: Halal certification is voluntary, and it is a business decision for companies if they wish to attain Halal certification. Fresh, whole eggs are suitable for Muslim consumption on condition that it has not been cross-mixed with any non-Halal ingredients.

questionListItems.title: I am in the organising committee for my company's function that will be held in a hotel. How do I cater Halal food for my Muslim colleagues?

answer.body:
For clients requiring halal food for events held at non-halal certified hotels, we do offer the services that you require which is the Ad-Hoc Halal Certification Services.


We offer 3 Packages for this service:

Package A, which comprises of both ritual cleansing and food verification service;

Package B, which comprises of the ritual cleansing service only and

Package C, which comprises of the food verification service only.


We generally recommend Package A to our clients, as it is inclusive of both services that are essential in assuring that the food that will be served in the event is halal-compliant.


To apply for our Ad Hoc Halal Certification Services, you would have to complete our application form and forward us the completed copy, along with menu card for the event and supporting halal certificates for its ingredients, latest by 14 working days before date of event. We will alert you should there be any shortcomings in your application and give you a deadline to rectify. After all the requirements have been met, we will process the application and issue you an invoice within 5 working days.


Please do note that we are unable to make any arrangement for the date and timing of the cleansing as it is subject to our contractors' schedule. However, we will take note of the requested date, and will provide their contact numbers when we issue you your invoice, to which you may proceed to liaise with them directly

questionListItems.title: How do I apply for Muis Halal Certification?

answer.body:
All Halal applications have to be made via LicenceOne (https://licence1.business.gov.sg).


You may wish to refer to the steps below for a better idea:

Generally, there are 3 types of requirements in the Halal application process:

  1. Halal Requirements - All raw materials used must be Halal and substantiated with supporting documents;

  2. Staffing Requirements - There must be a minimum of 2 or 3 Muslim staff employed in each premises applied for Halal certification (3 for Catering or Central Kitchen)

  3. System Requirements - The applicant must comply with the 10 principles of the Singapore Muis Halal Quality Management System (HalMQ).


Refer below for the process of applying to Muis Halal Certification.

1. Steps to follow prior to submitting an Application for Muis Halal Certification:-

  • Muis Halal Certification Conditions (HCC):

    • Please read through Muis Halal Certification Conditions (HCC) found on our website, http://www.halal.sg > Halal Certification > Scheme Types & Eligibility Criteria (HCC) before submitting the application in LicenceOne (https://licence1.business.gov.sg).

  • Fees Schedule:

    • The list of fees schedule is as attached and can be found the website, http://www.halal.sg > Halal Certification > Halal Fees Schedules. Please take note that application fee is applicable for new applications for all schemes and is non-refundable.

  • Registration:

    • All applications are submitted via LicenceOne. Please log-in using your CorpPass (applicable to all other schemes) or SingPass (applicable for Hawker and School Canteen schemes).


2. Steps to follow to submit a "New" application for Muis Halal Certification:

Step 1: Login

Step 2: Select "Apply for New License"

Step 3: Select "Halal Certification"

Step 4: Click "Next" after verifying the auto-populated info

Step 5: Verify auto-populated info

Step 6: Select "Express" or "Normal" Application, Select multiple schemes if necessary, Verify premises details, Input Halal team member details, Upload supporting documents (e.g. Menu/Product List, Ingredient List, Floor Plan, Labels, etc) & Click "Next"

Step 7: General Declaration & Click "Submit" and "Proceed"

Step 8: Review Information entered, Select check-box after reading and agreeing to the declarations & Click "Submit"

Step 9: Application Submission Notification appears onscreen


Take note that it is mandatory for one Muslim representative and one other staff in the Halal team to attend the Halal training programmed by Muis-appointed training provider, Warees Halal.

For training registration or query, please contact Ms Nur Aini Masturah at 6291 2702 or email halaltraining@wareeshalal.sg.


Below is the brief steps in the process of Halal certification upon successful submission of the application in the e-Halal system.

Process of Halal Certification:-


Desktop Audit

The auditor will look through your application online. If the application lacks any information or requires clarifications, the auditor will send you a shortcoming notification/Request For Action (RFA) through the system.


Shortcoming / Request For Action

Please follow the steps to submit the requested information in the system. Kindly ensure that you reply to the shortcoming notification prior to the deadline given, via LicenseOne on or before the due date.


Audit Inspection

The auditor will then make an appointment to come down for the audit inspection.


Recommended

The auditor will recommend the application to Muis upon compliance to Muis Halal Certification Conditions.


Approval

An invoice will be sent to the registered email once the certificate is ready for collection.


3. Steps to follow Post Certification:

Muis Halal certificate holder shall ensure that Muis Halal Certification Conditions are complied with at all times.

Pursuant to Muis Halal Certification Conditions, companies are required to update Muis by submitting a 'Change"/"Amend" Application, should there be any changes to their halal team, Muslim staff, supplier, products or ingredients/raw materials.

Please follow the steps below to submit a change application:

Step 1: Login > Under "Halal Certification", Select "Amend" as your action

Step 2: Profile > Select one of the two options

Step 3: General Information > Click "Next" after verifying the auto-populated info

Step 4: Application Details > Review Application Info, Amend Application Info,

Step 5: Upload Attachments - Click "Upload"

Step 6: Review & Submit - Read Declaration, Select check box & Click "Next"

Step 7: Receive "Acknowledgement" that submission is successful


Please also note that changes can be implemented only when approval from Muis has been granted.

questionListItems.title: How much is the application fee for Haj?

answer.body: Currently, the application fee is at $240.00 for each applicant, as Muis is providing a $90.00 subsidy in view of economic conditions. The application fee will gradually increase to $285.00 from 1 Jan 2024 till 31 Dec 2025; and subsequently will increase to the full quantum of $330.00 on 1 Jan 2026 onwards. The fees mentioned do not include prevailing GST.

questionListItems.title: What if I do not have a Singpass account?

answer.body: You can register for a Singpass account on the Singpass website (https://www.singpass.gov.sg). Alternatively, you may visit a Singpass counter for assistance. You can locate the nearest Singpass counter at https://go.gov.sg/singpass-counters.

questionListItems.title: Can I come to Muis to register for Haj?

answer.body: No, you need not do so. We have designed MyHajSG to allow you to access the system anywhere at your convenience.

questionListItems.title: What other financial assistance schemes that are available for Madrasah Students?

answer.body:
There are various additional assistance schemes. Please proceed to the link of the respective organisation for more details:

  • LBKM Bursary (http://lbkm.org.sg/bursary-scholarship/lbkm-bursaries)

  • SPH School Pocket Money Fund (https://www.spmf.org.sg/primary-secondary-students)

  • CC Bursaries (depends on respective constituency)

  • Muslimin Trust Fund Association (for orphans) https://www.mtfa.org/financial-assistance/

  • Compassion Fund http://compassionfund.sg/

questionListItems.title: How do I apply for Muis Zakat Financial Assistance?

answer.body: Application for Zakat financial assistance is available at our partner Social Development (SD) Mosques. Through the Mosque Cluster (MC) model, the SD Mosques are now more accessible and better placed to support those in need. If you know anyone who might need financial assistance, you may refer them to an SD Mosque nearest to their house (please refer to https://zakat.sg/how-to-apply-zakat )

questionListItems.title: How long will it take to process my Muis Zakat Financial Assistance application?

answer.body: The application process can take up to 6 weeks. You will be notified of the outcome through mail. Interim assistance may be provided during the waiting period.

questionListItems.title: Are returning scholars guaranteed employment when they return from their studies?

answer.body:
i. Scholars will be placed under a centralised employment and career development scheme under Muis’ management.


ii. Scholars’ employment and career will be specially curated, and they may be deployed to Madrasahs, Mosques, Muis, and other agencies.


iii. Scholars with excellent performance in their undergraduate studies and subsequent deployments may be offered postgraduate scholarships as part of their career development based on their interests and needs of the Singapore Muslim community.

agency.name: Majlis Ugama Islam Singapura
agency.searchHint: Do I need to pay Zakat on Income?
